intro: Pachecoa prismatica, commonly known as the prismatic pachecoa, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its striking, colorful bracts that resemble petals. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are often hidden beneath the showy bracts. It thrives in high-altitude environments with cool, moist conditions. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
